intro: Galium scaberrimum, commonly known as rough bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium scaberrimum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
